articles.headline: Manchin Dangles Hopes of a Future Compromise. Democrats Revolt.
articles.snippet: A day after the West Virginia senator scuttled plans to pass a climate and tax package, many in his party blamed him for the demise of their ambitions and expressed a lack of trust in him.
articles.abstract: A day after the West Virginia senator scuttled plans to pass a climate and tax package, many in his party blamed him for the demise of their ambitions and expressed a lack of trust in him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It was a familiar, if excruciating, position for Democrats.

articles.headline: Elon Musk Claps Back at Twitter’s Lawsuit Over $44 Billion Deal
articles.snippet: Mr. Musk formally responded to Twitter’s attempt to force him to buy the company, arguing that there was no reason to hurry the case.
articles.abstract: Mr. Musk formally responded to Twitter’s attempt to force him to buy the company, arguing that there was no reason to hurry the case.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk accused Twitter on Friday of deceiving him about its service, obfuscating facts and not notifying him of executive changes, in his first formal response to the company’s lawsuit aimed at forcing him to complete a $44 billion acquisition of the social media service.
articles.byline: By Lauren Hirsch, Kate Conger and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: In a Flash of Fire and Shrapnel, a Smiling 4-Year-Old’s Life Is Snuffed Out
articles.snippet: A toddler with Down syndrome was happily pushing a stroller through a Ukraine park before a Russian missile landed. “I want to shout out to the whole world,” an anguished survivor of the attack cried.
articles.abstract: A toddler with Down syndrome was happily pushing a stroller through a Ukraine park before a Russian missile landed. “I want to shout out to the whole world,” an anguished survivor of the attack cried.
articles.lead_paragraph: VINNYTSIA, Ukraine — They called her Sunny Flower. She had just learned her first words. She liked to clean the corridor at the speech therapy center she attended, and organize the toys. She always seemed happy.
articles.byline: By Maria Varenikova and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: Biden’s Fraught Saudi Visit Garners Scathing Criticism and Modest Accords
articles.snippet: In the most politically problematic trip of his presidency, Mr. Biden’s critics accused him of helping rehabilitate the reputation of a tarnished prince in exchange for numerous, but limited gains.
articles.abstract: In the most politically problematic trip of his presidency, Mr. Biden’s critics accused him of helping rehabilitate the reputation of a tarnished prince in exchange for numerous, but limited gains.
articles.lead_paragraph: JEDDAH, Saudi Arabia — President Biden exchanged the shaken fist for a fist bump on Friday as he abandoned his promise to make Saudi Arabia a “pariah” and sat down with the crown prince he deemed responsible for the grisly killing and dismemberment of a columnist who lived in the United States.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Putin Aims to Shape a New Generation of Supporters, Through Schools
articles.snippet: Sweeping changes in the curriculum will soon cast the Russian president as a pivotal historical figure and mark an end of openness to the West.
articles.abstract: Sweeping changes in the curriculum will soon cast the Russian president as a pivotal historical figure and mark an end of openness to the West.
articles.lead_paragraph: Starting in first grade, students across Russia will soon sit through weekly classes featuring war movies and virtual tours through Crimea. They will be given a steady dose of lectures on topics like “the geopolitical situation” and “traditional values.” In addition to a regular flag-raising ceremony, they will be introduced to lessons celebrating Russia’s “rebirth” under President Vladimir V. Putin.

articles.headline: Egypt’s Revolving Jailhouse Door: One Pretrial Detention After Another
articles.snippet: An analysis of handwritten records shows that thousands of Egyptians have been detained without charge, sometimes for years.
articles.abstract: An analysis of handwritten records shows that thousands of Egyptians have been detained without charge, sometimes for years.
articles.lead_paragraph: An analysis of handwritten records shows that thousands of Egyptians have been detained without charge, sometimes for years.
articles.byline: By Vivian Yee, Allison McCann and Josh Holder

articles.headline: The Dollar Is Extremely Strong, Pushing Down the World
articles.snippet: The value of the U.S. dollar is the strongest it has been in a generation, devaluing other currencies and unsettling the global economic outlook.
articles.abstract: The value of the U.S. dollar is the strongest it has been in a generation, devaluing other currencies and unsettling the global economic outlook.
articles.lead_paragraph: The value of the U.S. dollar is the strongest it has been in a generation, devaluing other currencies and unsettling the global economic outlook.
articles.byline: By Karl Russell, Joe Rennison and Jason Karaian

articles.headline: A Warren Buffett Protégée Strikes Out on Her Own
articles.snippet: Tracy Britt Cool spent a decade working closely with the renowned investor. She is now applying those lessons to her own firm.
articles.abstract: Tracy Britt Cool spent a decade working closely with the renowned investor. She is now applying those lessons to her own firm.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tracy Britt Cool always knew she wanted to work in business. So, not unlike the star of a high school musical asking Steven Spielberg for a part, she figured she should start at the top.

articles.headline: The World Economy Is Imperiled by a Force Hiding in Plain Sight
articles.snippet: Well more than two years into the worst pandemic in a century, the accompanying economic shock continues to assault global fortunes.
articles.abstract: Well more than two years into the worst pandemic in a century, the accompanying economic shock continues to assault global fortunes.
articles.lead_paragraph: This past week brought home the magnitude of the overlapping crises assailing the global economy, intensifying fears of recession, job losses, hunger and a plunge on stock markets.

articles.headline: What New Abortion Bans Mean for the Youngest Patients
articles.snippet: One 10-year-old became the focus of debate, but more than 1,000 girls under 15 seek abortions each year. “How are we going to help the pregnant kids?”
articles.abstract: One 10-year-old became the focus of debate, but more than 1,000 girls under 15 seek abortions each year. “How are we going to help the pregnant kids?”
articles.lead_paragraph: She was just 10 years old, so young that many people were horrified when they heard it, and others refused to believe it. But the ordeal of the child rape victim in Ohio who had to cross state lines for an abortion, and the ugly political fight that followed, have highlighted two uncomfortable facts: Such pregnancies are not as rare as people think, and new abortion bans are likely to have a pronounced impact on the youngest pregnant girls.
articles.byline: By Dana Goldstein and Ava Sasani

articles.headline: A North Dakota City Attracted a Corn Mill. Then Came Questions About Its Chinese Owners.
articles.snippet: Officials in Grand Forks are enthusiastic about the potential benefit to the economy, but the connection to China stoked a backlash.
articles.abstract: Officials in Grand Forks are enthusiastic about the potential benefit to the economy, but the connection to China stoked a backlash.
articles.lead_paragraph: GRAND FORKS, N.D. — For years, the leaders of Grand Forks had their eyes on a patch of cropland north of town, not far from a pasta-making facility, a potato processor and a state-owned flour mill where farmers received top dollar for their wheat. That muddy field, they thought, would be the perfect place for another agriculture business.

articles.headline: Netflix, Still Reeling, Bets Big on ‘The Gray Man’
articles.snippet: The streaming service hopes its latest release can be the start of a blockbuster franchise that attracts much-needed subscribers.
articles.abstract: The streaming service hopes its latest release can be the start of a blockbuster franchise that attracts much-needed subscribers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anthony and Joe Russo like to go big.

articles.headline: As the Planet Cooks, Climate Stalls as a Political Issue
articles.snippet: Joe Manchin’s rejection of a compromise climate bill tells a familiar story: Voters and politicians put a higher premium on immediate issues, such as inflation and the economy, giving politicians a pass on global warming.
articles.abstract: Joe Manchin’s rejection of a compromise climate bill tells a familiar story: Voters and politicians put a higher premium on immediate issues, such as inflation and the economy, giving politicians a pass on global warming.
articles.lead_paragraph: Summers in Maricopa County, Ariz., have become at times unbearable, Kyle Hawkinson said on Friday. Smog and haze hung heavily over Phoenix, and residents were bracing for fire season, when the heat and air pollution would only grow worse. Climate change, he said, is at least partly to blame.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Weisman and Jazmine Ulloa

articles.headline: On Donetsk’s Front Line, Small Gains and Losses Impose a Heavy Toll
articles.snippet: Ukrainian soldiers say they live under almost constant Russian bombardment but dismiss any suggestion that they cede land.
articles.abstract: Ukrainian soldiers say they live under almost constant Russian bombardment but dismiss any suggestion that they cede land.
articles.lead_paragraph: DONETSK PROVINCE, Ukraine — Red flames crackled in the golden wheat field, the target of Russian artillery just minutes earlier. Nearby, the commander of a Ukrainian frontline unit was finishing his lunch of pasta from a tin bowl. As more incoming shells exploded in the fields, his men took cover in their bunkers.
articles.byline: By Carlotta Gall and Mauricio Lima

articles.headline: Report on Uvalde Shooting Finds ‘Systemic Failures’ in Police Response
articles.snippet: The decision to finally confront the gunman was made by a small group of officers and could have been made far earlier, the report found.
articles.abstract: The decision to finally confront the gunman was made by a small group of officers and could have been made far earlier, the report found.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The first comprehensive assessment of the law enforcement response to the deadly school shooting in Uvalde, Texas, found that blame for the failure to swiftly confront the gunman rested not only with the school police chief, but also with the scores of state and federal officers who gathered at the deadly scene but did not act.
articles.byline: By J. David Goodman and Edgar Sandoval

articles.headline: Global Central Banks Ramp Up Inflation Fight
articles.snippet: Central banks in the U.S., Europe, Canada and parts of Asia are lifting interest rates rapidly as they try to wrestle breakneck inflation under control.
articles.abstract: Central banks in the U.S., Europe, Canada and parts of Asia are lifting interest rates rapidly as they try to wrestle breakneck inflation under control.
articles.lead_paragraph: Central bankers around the world are lifting interest rates at an aggressive clip as rapid inflation persists and seeps into a broad array of goods and services, setting the global economy up for a lurch toward more expensive credit, lower stock and bond values and — potentially — a sharp pullback in economic activity.
articles.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Eshe Nelson

articles.headline: Reunited in Bucha, a Ukrainian Family Comes to Terms With War’s Traumas
articles.snippet: As flowers bloom amid the wreckage, the Kyiv suburb synonymous with atrocity feels almost normal again. But the lives of the people there may never be.
articles.abstract: As flowers bloom amid the wreckage, the Kyiv suburb synonymous with atrocity feels almost normal again. But the lives of the people there may never be.
articles.lead_paragraph: BUCHA, Ukraine — For the first time since the war began, the Stanislavchuk family was together again.

articles.headline: Covid Rises Across U.S. Amid Muted Warnings and Murky Data
articles.snippet: BA.5, a highly transmissible variant, is dominating a surge of new infections. Many health officials say the wave is cause for caution, not alarm.
articles.abstract: BA.5, a highly transmissible variant, is dominating a surge of new infections. Many health officials say the wave is cause for caution, not alarm.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Covid-19 is surging around the United States again in what experts consider the most transmissible variant of the pandemic yet.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman, Thomas Fuller and Edgar Sandoval

articles.headline: Amazon C.E.O. Andy Jassy Breaks From the Bezos Way
articles.snippet: Jeff Bezos’ successor has set himself apart with a hands-on approach in Washington.
articles.abstract: Jeff Bezos’ successor has set himself apart with a hands-on approach in Washington.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Jeff Bezos was chief executive of Amazon, he took an arm’s-length stance toward the company’s affairs in Washington. He rarely lobbied lawmakers. He testified only once before Congress, under the threat of subpoena.
articles.byline: By David McCabe and Karen Weise
